title: YKK’s New DynaPel™ Water-Repellant Zipper Wins Best Product In ISPO Textrends Competition - Textile World Magazine
summary: YKK's DynaPel™ water-repellent zipper has been recognized as the Best Product in the accessories category at the ISPO Textrends Awards. The zipper is designed to be compatible with garment recycling systems, eliminating the challenges that PU poses to recycling systems. The lack of a PU film helps remove one of the barriers of textile-to-textile recycling of performance apparel.

title: Oleochemicals Market Size Estimated to Reach USD 46.26 Billion by 2032 - GlobeNewswire
summary: The global oleochemicals market size was valued at USD 22.66 billion in 2022 and is anticipated to reach USD 46.26 billion by 2032, growing at a CAGR of 7.4% during the forecast period. The market growth is primarily driven by rising demand for bio-based products, increasing government initiatives, growing consumer awareness, expanding applications in diverse sectors, and technological advancements. Furthermore, the shift towards green chemistry practices is contributing to the increasing popularity of oleochemicals.
green_innovation: TRUE. Oleochemicals are chemical compounds derived from natural fats and oils, which are renewable resources. They offer sustainable alternatives to traditional petroleum-based products and contribute to reducing the environmental impact of various industries.
business_innovation: TRUE. The article highlights the rising demand for oleochemicals across diverse sectors, including personal care, cosmetics, food & beverages, and pharmaceuticals. This growing demand indicates that oleochemicals are gaining recognition as valuable ingredients and additives, leading to new product development and process optimization in these industries.
green_product: TRUE. Oleochemicals are derived from renewable resources and are biodegradable, making them environmentally friendly. They offer sustainable alternatives to conventional ingredients and additives, reducing the ecological footprint of products in which they are used.
green_process: TRUE. The production of oleochemicals involves processes that aim to minimize environmental impact and promote sustainability. These processes often utilize renewable resources, reduce waste and emissions, and conserve energy, contributing to a greener manufacturing approach.

title: “Wool-based products improve crop production” - hortidaily.com
summary: Veratin has launched two new products for its Verigrow range, including a biodegradable pot, Verigrow Pot, and a fertilizer supplement, Verigrow Supplement. Verigrow Pot uses a novel biodegradable material that acts as food as it decomposes, helping plants get the nutrients they need as they are placed in the ground. Verigrow Supplement complements the Company’s existing range of liquid fertilizer and soil improver products by acting as an all-purpose product containing a balanced blend of macro (except phosphorus), micronutrients, and trace elements.
green_innovation: TRUE. Veratin's Verigrow range of products are green innovations because they are designed to reduce environmental impact through the use of biodegradable materials and the reduction of the need for harmful plastics and fertilizers.
business_innovation: TRUE. Veratin's Verigrow range of products are business innovations because they are new or improved products that differ significantly from the firm's previous products and have been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE. Veratin's Verigrow Pot and Verigrow Supplement are green products because they are designed to reduce environmental impact through the use of biodegradable materials and the reduction of the need for harmful plastics and fertilizers.
green_process: TRUE. Veratin's Verigrow range of products are green processes because they are new or improved processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous processes and have been brought into use in the firm. These processes aim to reduce waste, conserve natural resources, decrease energy consumption, and limit the release of harmful substances into the environment.

title: Big Freedia’s Black Opal Collaboration Is All About Bounce - Essence
